header.title: CosPropertyService_PropertySet

erlref.modulesummary: This module implements the OMG CosPropertyService::PropertySet interface.

description.p:
To get access to the record definitions for the structures use:
-include_lib("cosProperty/include/CosPropertyService.hrl").

func.name: define_property(PropertySet, Name, Value) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Add a new property to the target object

desc.p: This operation adds a new property to the given object. Depending on which initial arguments was supplied when starting the object several exceptions may be raised.

func.name: define_properties(PropertySet, Properties) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Add new properties to the target object

type.v: Reason = invalid_property_name | conflicting_property | property_not_found | unsupported_type_code | unsupported_property | unsupported_mode | fixed_property | read_only_property

desc.p: This operation adds several new properties to the given object. Depending on which initial arguments was supplied when starting the object an exceptions may be raised listing the properties failing.

func.name: get_number_of_properties(PropertySet) -> ulong()
func.fsummary: Get the number of properties associated with the target object

desc.p: This operation returns the number of properties associated with the target object.

func.name: get_all_property_names(PropertySet, Max) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Get Maxproperty names. If the target object have additional associated properties they will be put in the returned Iterator

desc.p: This operation returns up to Max property names. If the target object have additional associated properties they will be put in the returned Iterator, otherwise the Iterator will be a NIL object.

func.name: get_property_value(PropertySet, Name) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return the property value associated with given name

desc.p: This operation returns the property value associated with given name. If no such property exists or the given name is an empty string an exception will be raised.

func.name: get_properties(PropertySet, Names) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return all properties associated with given names

desc.p: This operation returns all properties associated with given names. If the boolean flag is true all properties where retrieved correctly, otherwise, all properties with the type tk_void was not found.

func.name: get_all_properties(PropertySet, Max) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return a list Maxproperties or less. If more properties are associated with the target object they will be put in thePropertiesIterator.

desc.p: This operation return a list Max properties or less. If more properties are associated with the target object they will be put in the PropertiesIterator. If the object had less than Max associated properties the Iterator will be a NIL object.

func.name: delete_property(PropertySet, Name) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Delete the property with given Name

desc.p: This operation tries to delete the property with given Name. An exception which indicates why it failed is raised if so needed.

func.name: delete_properties(PropertySet, Names) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Delete all properties with given Names

type.v: Reason = invalid_property_name | conflicting_property | property_not_found | unsupported_type_code | unsupported_property | unsupported_mode | fixed_property | read_only_property

desc.p: This operation tries to delete all given Properties. If one or more removal fails an exception is raised which describe why.
This operation deletes all properties. The boolean flag, if set to false, indicates that it was not possible to remove one or more properties, e.g., may be read only.

func.name: is_property_defined(PropertySet, Name) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return true if the target have an associated property with given name

desc.p: This operation returns true if the target have an associated property with given name.
